alert.note: Alert for Central Piscataquis; Northeast Aroostook; Northern Piscataquis; Northern Somerset; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 11 at 12:34AM EST until January 11 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills and very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 to 45 below zero expected this morning. Wind chills as low as 20 to 30 below zero expected this afternoon. * WHERE...Portions of Central Highlands, Far Northern and North Woods Maine. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon EST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon to 6 PM EST Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and the wind will create dangerously low wind chill values. Frostbite can occur quickly and even hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken. A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and the wind will combine to create low wind chills. Frostbite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Make sure you wear a hat and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Central Piscataquis; Northeast Aroostook; Northern Piscataquis; Northern Somerset; Northwest Aroostook
